    • Constructor Detail

      • Iec62056Connection

        public Iec62056Connection(SerialSettings serialSettings)
        Creates a Connection object. You must call open() before calling read() in order to read data. The timeout is set by default to 5s.
        Parameters:
        serialSettings - serial port settings, containing serial parameters and port name. Defaults are 300bd 7E1 by 5s timeout, whereas examples for serial port identifiers are on Linux "/dev/ttyS0" or "/dev/ttyUSB0" and on Windows "COM1"

      • Iec62056Connection

        public Iec62056Connection(SerialConnection serial)
        Creates a Connection object. You must call open() before calling read() in order to read data. The timeout is set by default to 5s.
        Parameters:
        serial - serial port connection object.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the maximum time in ms to wait for new data from the remote device. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time in ms to wait for new data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error occurs setting the serial port timeout.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout in ms.
        Returns:
        the timeout in ms.

      • open

        public boolean open()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the serial port associated with this connection.
        Returns:
        if the connection is already open, or was successfully opened.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error occurs opening the serial port.

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the serial port.
        Returns:
        if the connection is already closed, or was successfully closed.

      • read

        public java.util.List<DataSet> read(Iec62056Settings settings,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Requests a data message from the remote device using IEC 62056-21. The data message received is parsed and a list of data sets is returned.
        Parameters:
        settings - connection settings, containing configurations regarding authentication, maximum baud rate, handshake or to tell the connection to throw away echos of outgoing messages. Echos are caused by some optical transceivers. A maximum baud rate can be set while the handshake is performed. For some devices it is necessary to wait before changing the baud rate during message exchange. This parameter can usually be set to zero for regular serial ports. If a USB to serial converter is used, you might have to use a delay of around 250ms because otherwise the baud rate is changed before the previous message (i.e. the acknowledgment) has been completely sent.
        ids - a set of IDs/Addresses of data sets. The ID is usually an OBIS code of the format A-B:C.D.E*F or on older EDIS code of the format C.D.E. that specifies exactly what the value of this data set represents. C is the type of the measured quantity (e.g 1 = positive active power), D describes the measurement mode and E is the tariff (e.g. 0 for total or 1 for tariff 1 only) associated with this value.
        Returns:
        A list of data sets contained in the data message response from the remote device. The first data set will contain the "identification" of the meter as the id and empty strings for value and unit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error other than timeout occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • read

        public java.util.List<DataSet> read(Iec62056Settings settings)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Requests a data message from the remote device using IEC 62056-21. The data message received is parsed and a list of data sets is returned.
        Parameters:
        settings - connection settings, containing configurations regarding authentication, maximum baud rate, handshake or to tell the connection to throw away echos of outgoing messages. Echos are caused by some optical transceivers. A maximum baud rate can be set while the handshake is performed. For some devices it is necessary to wait before changing the baud rate during message exchange. This parameter can usually be set to zero for regular serial ports. If a USB to serial converter is used, you might have to use a delay of around 250ms because otherwise the baud rate is changed before the previous message (i.e. the acknowledgment) has been completely sent.
        Returns:
        A list of data sets contained in the data message response from the remote device. The first data set will contain the "identification" of the meter as the id and empty strings for value and unit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error other than timeout occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • byteToAscii

        public static java.lang.String byteToAscii(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to an ASCII string by looping through the array.
        IEC 62056-21 commands will be recognized and indicated with angle brackets, e.g. 0x01 will be printed as <SOH>. An empty hex value 0x00 will be converted to a blank space.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the message to be converted.
        Returns:
        the message as an ASCII string.

      • asciiToHexBytes

        public static byte[] asciiToHexBytes(java.lang.String ascii)
        Converts an ASCII string to hex by looping through every single character. IEC 62056-21 commands are possible by using angle brackets, e.g <BCC> will be automatically calculated when calling getBCC().
        Parameters:
        ascii - the string to be converted.
        Returns:
        the message as a byte array.
